meanings.definition: Make or become unclear or less distinct.
meanings.sent1: When I run really fast, everything blurs around me.
meanings.sent2: The rain on the window blurs the view of the garden.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick blurs the line between reality and illusion.
meanings.sent4: Her tears blur the pain in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The fog blurs the outline of the distant mountains.

meanings.definition: A thing that cannot be seen or heard clearly.
meanings.sent1: In the dark forest, shadows and blurs danced around us.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious figure in the photo was just a blur.
meanings.sent3: The ghostly blur in the attic gave me a fright.
meanings.sent4: The blur of colors in the painting created a sense of movement.
meanings.sent5: The blur of voices in the crowded room was overwhelming.

meanings.definition: A smear or stain that obscures.
meanings.sent1: She tried to wipe off the blur on her glasses.
meanings.sent2: The ink blot formed a blur on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate stain left a blur on his shirt.
meanings.sent4: The blur of paint on the canvas added depth to the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The blur of dust on the mirror made it hard to see.
